card.title: Welcome
card.text: Peter Rabbit, by Beatrix Potter. Are you ready to begin?

voice.intro: Peter Rabbit, by Beatrix Potter. Are you ready to begin?

Once upon a time there were four little rabbits, and their names were
Flopsy, Mopsy, Cotton-tail and Peter.


They lived with their mother in a sand-bank, underneath the root of a
very big fir tree.

"Now, my dears," said old Mrs. Rabbit one morning, "You may go into
the fields or down the lane, but don't go into Mr. McGregor's garden.

Your father had an accident there; he was put in a pie by Mrs.
McGregor."

Now run along and don't get into mischief. I am going out."

Then old Mrs. Rabbit took a basket and her umbrella and went through
the wood to the baker's.

Do you want to hear about flopsy or about peter?

Now Peter who was very naughty, ran straight away to Mr. McGregor's
garden and squeezed under the gate!

He saw a huge amount of juicy vegetables growing - lettuces, cucumbers and cabbages. Which do you think he went to eat first?
Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-tail who were good little bunnies went down the lane together to gather blackberries. Would you like to hear about peter now?

Peter first hopped over to the lettuces and sniffed them. They smelt so fresh! He crunched his teeth into them and gobbled down a whole lettuce.

Once he had had his fill, he spotted over at the other side of the garden a patch of cucumbers and cabbages. Which one do you think he should check first?

Peter hopped over to the cucumbers - they were perfectly ripe! Snapping the stalk off with his teeth, he opened his mouth as wide as it could go and tore into the cucumber. Delicious!

When he was full, he spotted some cabbages in the neighbouring patch. Do you think he should go and test those, too?

Peter hopped up to the cabbages and tucked in! He ate two hole cabbages - a big meal for such a little rabbit!
Peter felt satisfied. His belly was so full he had to hop carefully round the rest of the garden not to upset it.

But round the end of a cabbage patch, whom should he meet but Mr.
McGregor!

Mr. McGregor was on his hands and knees planting out young cabbages,
but he jumped up and ran after Peter, waving a rake and calling out
"Stop thief!"
Do you think peter should make a run for it?
This is the last point in story for now.
